page.title: 08History of Transport
page.content: The area is of an undulating nature, and this topography has presented difficuties in the construction of transport features. The Birmingham- Worcester canal of 1791-1815 crosses our block and runs through Shortwood Tunnel. The canal carried many products, and served local needs e.g. bricks, agriculture, needlemaking. In the mid - 19 th. century came the Birmingham - Gloucester Railway, which later became part of The Midland Railway, and the L.M.S.R. The railway robbed the canal of its trade, and today the main industry of the canal is tourism. The main road in the block connects Alvechurch to Birmingham and Redditch.Recently excavation work on the nearby M42 began, and this will cut across the north of the parish on its completion in 1986.
